Couple make a home out of two shipping containers in Central Hawke’s Bay https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/the- Couple-who-made-a-home-out-of-two-shipping-containers-in-central-hawkes-bay/ M2MKED4J25AJ3HUCPRRMWWJP6A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/the- Couple-who-made-a-home-out-of-two-shipping-containers-in-central-hawkes-bay/ M2MKED4J25AJ3HUCPRRMWWJP6A/ Michaela Gower'It’s the simplest, most lovely way to live.' Fri, 23 Aug 2024 18:00:00 +0000 Andrew Rosvall and Suse Grieve say their tiny home has everything they need.
Racing: Crocetti’s start in Hawke’s Bay’s Tarzino Trophy will be weather-dependent https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/racing-crocettis-start-in-hawkes-bays-tarzino-tropy-will-be-weather-dependent/EL24TG26ZJGXPOOVNYD3X3ZMUM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/racing-crocettis-start-in-hawkes-bays-tarzino-tropy-will-be-weather-dependent/EL24TG26ZJGXPOOVNYD3X3ZMUM/ John JenkinsHis connections say he will not be at Hastings if the racing surface comes up heavy. Fri, 23 Aug 2024 18:00:00 +0000 Crocetti (left) produced a game performance to beat Master Fay in an Open 1100m race at Ruakākā on August 3 when unsuited by the heavy track conditions. He has since won a Taupō 1100m trial and is a $2.20 favourite for the Group 1 Tarzino Trophy (1400m) at Hastings on September 7. Photo / Race Images
Slowlife Collection: How a China OE inspired a distinctly Kiwi picnicware brand https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/slowlife-collection-how-a-china-oe-inspired-a-distinctly-kiwi-picnicware-brand/KH2ER3GU7FDAPMCT5YUZGWL3S4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/slowlife-collection-how-a-china-oe-inspired-a-distinctly-kiwi-picnicware-brand/KH2ER3GU7FDAPMCT5YUZGWL3S4/ Mitchell Hageman'If you find the right factory, they are quite open to building relationships.' Fri, 23 Aug 2024 18:00:00 +0000 LouLou Ellingham's Hawke's Bay-conceived picnic and leisurewear brand Slowlife was partly conceived on the fast-paced shores of mainland China.

Join Gisborne’s Daffodil Rally: Support the cancer society with your car https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/08/24/join-gisbornes-daffodil-rally-support-the-cancer-society-with-your-car/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/08/24/join-gisbornes-daffodil-rally-support-the-cancer-society-with-your-car/ Wynsley WrigleyGisborne Vintage Car Club's Daffodil Rally for Cancer invites all vehicles on August 25. Fri, 23 Aug 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Gisborne Vintage Car Club veterans Rod Clague (left) and Graeme Revell invite all vehicle owners - not just those with vintage vehicles - to take part in the club's Daffodil Rally for Cancer tomorrow. Revell's 1946 Chevrolet A pick-up will be one of the vehicles on display at The Warehouse from 10am. The rally to Tolaga Bay starts at 1pm. Photo / Wynsley Wrigley
